comment._content: Augustus Thomas (January 8, 1857 – August 12, 1934) was an American playwright, born in St. Louis, Missouri. The son of a doctor, he worked a number of jobs including a page in the 41st Congress, studying law and gaining some practical railway work experience before he turned to journalism and became editor of the Kansas City Mirror in 1889. Thomas had been writing since his teens when he wrote plays and even organized a small theatrical touring company. Source: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Augustus_Thomas
